posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.44.0-beta.1. If youre interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • We fixed a minor animation bug during group calls. We apologize in advance if the most exciting part of your day was switching to grid view during a meeting and trying to catch the moment where the video squares from people who joined late sometimes partially obscured the slide deck your boss was presenting.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.43.0-beta.1v7.44.0-beta.1 路 signalapp/Signal-Desktop 路 GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Comparing v7.43.0-beta.1...v7.44.0-beta.1 路 signalapp/Signal-Desktop 路 GitHub

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.44.0-beta.1

41 new commits since 7.43.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.44.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Remove unused string [2]

  • Remove another unused string [3]

  • Fix persistence of last window size and position [4]

  • Release Note Channel: Mute/Unmute UI, hide UI elements [5]

  • Trim message whitespace in more situations [6]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.4 [7]

  • Bump electron from 34.1.0 to 34.1.1 [8]

  • Fix "Default" mic display [9]

  • Fix handling of encrypted unprocessed envelopes [10]

  • Only show error toast when importing unknown frames [11]

  • Update to the latest SignalService.proto [12]

  • Fix combining group change messages [13]

  • Fix 1:1 calls [14]

  • Show dialog for permanently undownloadable attachments [15]

  • Update string to match iOS/Android [16]

  • Upgrade libsignal to 0.66.1 [17]

  • Vary number of decimals of file sizes [18]

  • Update link & sync release notes [19]

  • Add description to device name field in settings page [20]

  • Fix forwarding messages with undownloadable attachments [21]

  • Enable link & sync in production [22]

  • Refactor app initialization logic [23]

  • Fix sql error when restoring from interrupted sync [24]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.5 [25]

  • Release Notes Channel: Fix behavior when conversation is blocked [26]

  • Refactor fast-glob pattern [27]

  • Update name for remote config for ringrtc ADM [28]

  • Update release notes for 7.43 [29]

  • Update strings [30]

  • Update DNS fallback [31]

  • Make link-and-sync downloads resumable [32]

  • Pass proxy down to libsignal Net instance [33]

  • Prevent element resize when timeline is scroll-locked [34]

  • Support system name fields & upgrade libsignal [35]

  • Use libsignal Net without proxy on rejection [36]

  • Fix call animation from speaker to grid view so animating speaker is on top [37]

  • Avoid errant scroll on context menu hide [38]

  • Update release notes [39]

  • Update strings [40]

  • 7.44.0-beta.1 [41]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.43.0-beta.1v7.44.0-beta.1

Link to previous desktop beta v7.43: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.43 release - #13 by skmedix

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.43 release

posts.cooked: When will the update be available in the beta app of Signal itself for MacOS?

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: I believe it already is. If you didnt get it yet, could you send me your debug log, please?
I havent, send you a DM.

posts.name: skmedix
posts.cooked:
updates-bot:

Refactor fast-glob pattern [27]

Please consider switching fast-glob to tinyglobby, it should be lighter in dependencies and vite, vitest, etc. use it as well.

posts.name: 吼葛
posts.cooked: Just curious about something: is history syncing a phased rollout in production? My friend didnt get the dialogue.

posts.name: 吼葛
posts.cooked:
Same friend downloaded beta and got an error that history couldnt be synced.

Log

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.44.0-beta.1/1a6fca44e8d1e4a33e4fbf29d02e5fdc5bb44f98595abf2197a4399a7f093f88.gz

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: In the current iteration of the feature we are never overwriting existing message history. Theyll have to go into Desktops settings > Privacy and erase all data before linking in order to get the history synced!

posts.name: 吼葛
posts.cooked: Thank you! Theyll be thrilled.

posts.name: 吼葛
posts.cooked:
They said sync failed after clearing data and nothing was actually deleted after relinking.

Log

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.43.0/99401bf749c266bf957bfa2015d0e958f87e57d8666f5d5be96f87ed26b436d6.gz

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked:
Sorry, it looks like they may not have erased the data in the Desktop (as there are log entries from 2 days ago). What I was referring to is this UI in Settings > Privacy:

image898250 19.5 KB

posts.name: 吼葛
posts.cooked: I thought thats what they did . Ill tell them to stop being silly and click the right button.

posts.name: 吼葛
posts.cooked: They said thats the button they clicked . I can ask them to try again.

posts.name: Intiiii
posts.cooked: Hi, I noticed that the scaling option in the windows settings only works the first time you open the app. If I close it and open the app again, the scaling option only scales the settings window

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: Hm and yet they saw their messages after they linked again? Id love to take a look at a new log if they are willing to go through erase + link again. (FWIW, might also be worth checking that they are on the latest version of Android/iOS app, even though in the logs I dont see an indication of this being important yet)

Why is the startup of Signal Desktop so extreeeeeeeeeeeeemly slow recently? I cant be the only one with that problem. It happens on different computers of mine when I have them turned off for some hours or days. It takes very long (an hour) to download all the messages.

And even when I do not close Signal but keep it open and put the computer to standby, then after resuming it takes ages to update all the messages and Signal gets unresponsive, sometimes I cant set reactions. This is new.

I am on Linux btw.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Mine is super slow on windows when retrieving messages on startup. It shows tons of disk activity

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: Sorry about this. We are looking into this, and if you have a debuglog - itd help a lot!
